alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 22 at 1:25AM MST until February 23 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, Shirley Basin, Central Carbon County and North Snowy Range Foothills. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to 9 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin
